Michael Manns thriller, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Tina (2021)
programme.desc: Born Anna Mae Bullock in 1939, Tina Turner has sold in excess of 100 million records and earned numerous plaudits including Grammy awards and induction into the Rock And Roll Hall Of Fame with her first husband, Ike Turner. She was the first woman to grace the cover of Rolling Stone magazine and dabbled in acting including a memorable performance opposite Mel Gibson in Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome. Following a prolonged period of ill health, Turner intends to retire from the spotlight with her second husband, Erwin Bach. She bids farewell to her fans in the emotional documentary Tina. Directed by Dan Lindsay and TJ Martin, the film invites the singer to reminisce about her turbulent life and career with glowing contributions from friends, family and fans including Oprah Winfrey and Angela Bassett

programme.desc: The life of Ramses II - also known as Ramses the Great - who was a pharaoh of Egypt during the New Kingdom, a period of great prosperity for the country. programme.title: Ramses the Great: King of Ancient Egypt

programme.title: Ramses the Great: King of Ancient Egypt
programme.desc: The secrets and lies of mighty pharaoh Ramses II, who ruled Egypt from 1279 to 1213BC - one of the longest reigns in pharaonic history. He was a cultural innovator, diplomat and self-promoter. He built monuments all over Egypt and as this documentary reveals became a caricature of his own propaganda for thousands of years

programme.title: Ramses the Great: King of Ancient Egypt
programme.desc: After five years reign, Ramses II - also known as Ramses the Great - had already earned the distinction of being the most feared and respected among the martial pharaohs. He personally led his army with the aim of re-conquering the kingdoms of the Levant

Plus, a perfectly shaped ball of golden fur melts out of the frozen ground of the Yukons gold fields

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Global Adventure

programme.title: Stargate Universe

programme.desc: The crew members are unsettled when the Destiny crosses into another galaxy, leaving no hope of rescue. Sci-fi, starring Robert Carlyle and Kathleen Munroe

programme.title: Stargate Universe
programme.desc: Life on board the Destiny appears to be taking its toll on members of the crew when they suffer hallucinations, bringing their innermost fears and desires to life. Sci-fi drama, starring Alaina Huffman

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster reveals how life has learnt to adapt quickly in the ever-changing volcanic landscape, resulting in species that exist nowhere else in the world. David investigates the driving forces behind their evolution, exploring the appearance and behaviour of remarkable creatures and vegetation including giant whale sharks, marine iguanas and seemingly normal dandelion seeds that grow into plants the size of trees

programme.desc: Carrie Crowley takes a look at inspiring projects across Ireland, where architectural legacies are being preserved and transformed into vital community spaces. In this episode, Carrie visits the historic town of Castleblayney, Co Monaghan, which takes its name from Blayney Castle, once the focal point of the area. Renamed Hope Castle in the 1850s, the castles gate lodge fell into disrepair with the passage of time. Carrie follows along as the local townspeople come together to reimagine the space

programme.title: Glacaim Leat
programme.desc: Reflective documentary marking a decade since Ireland made history in 2015, when it became the first country to legalise same-sex marriage by public referendum. Blending love story, political reckoning, and cultural memory, the film follows the people who helped shape that journey and those now living its legacy. Shot over a year and culminating at Dublin Pride 2025, the film is a reminder that Pride is still a protest. As more LGBTQ+ people say they no longer feel safe, the film challenges us to confront the gap between the promise of 2015 and the reality of today

programme.title: James May: My Sisters Top Toys
programme.desc: The Top Gear presenter delves into the archives in a multi-layered investigation into his siblings favourite toys. Both a social study and a tale of brotherly revenge, James quirky journey sets about testing his theory that toys reveal as much about the nation that embraced them as any history book. programme.title: Ghosts

programme.title: Ghosts

Barbara struggles to understand why expectant father Frank Robbins would pressure his wife to bear him a son, while Sister Monica Joan is feeling sidelined - until she finds herself unexpectedly assisting Shelagh with an emergency birth. programme.desc: Sid Owen guest stars as the limo driver of a fading pop star who is suspected of raping a student found unconscious in an alley by Reg and Tony. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Questioned for beating up schoolboy Paul Herriot, irate father Bryce Lucas admits to Ben and Mickey he did so because he had been sent a videotape of the boy sexually assaulting his daughter - a pupil at the same school. Further investigation uncovers a cycle of abuse involving the disturbed youngster, but his story doesnt quite add up and there are further shocks in store, even for Sun Hills most worldy wise officers

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Stuarts driver Trevor Jones (Sid Owen) helps CID with useful information about a limousine operator who is rumoured to be supplying cocaine as part of the champagne service. Mickey volunteers to pose as a city banker and gather evidence against the villain, but has a few uncomfortable moments when it becomes clear his cover has been blown

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: When Stuarts driver Trevor Jones and a female friend are badly beaten up, the detective sets out to link the attack to a mysterious drug dealer known only as the Postman. Meanwhile, Nate and Ben answer a call to a disturbance at a cafe where a boy has had paint sprayed in his face. The assault has racial overtones and the discovery of narcotics at the scene provides a vital lead for the CID investigation

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Stuart is horrified to discover his trusted driver and friend is the mystery drug dealer the Postman, who plans to use him as his inside man at Sun Hill, using incriminating photos and unexplained payments into his bank account to blackmail him. Jo rumbles what is going on, but Stuarts efforts to put matters right just lead to greater danger. Sid Owen guest stars

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine in the hope of winning the £10,000 pound jackpot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A mayday call from a yacht triggers a search and rescue operation involving multiple agencies including the Air Force and the Auckland Rescue Helicopter team

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A huge team of volunteers from across the South Island gathers on the West Coast to search for a Swedish national who went hunting in the Karangarua Valley area but never returned

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: Join ambulances, helicopters and boats across New Zealand, transporting critical patients to safety. A teenage forestry worker receives a life-threatening injury, severe asthma endangers a mums life and police help young divers safely to shore

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A woman gets caught on the wrong end of a fishing spear, theres a daring rescue at sea and a chopper crew welcomes a new life mid-flight

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing and TOWIE star Pete Wicks immerses himself in the heart-warming and emotional world of dog care at Basildons Dogs Trust rehoming centre. Its Petes first day at Dogs Trust, and he meets a pug facing a worrying surgery and pregnant dog who was seized at the border

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Rescue Labrador Tom needs work with a serious wound on one of his front paws, and four-year-old French bulldog called Otis has suffered an accident while being chased by another dog. Professor Noel Fitzpatrick diagnoses a spinal problem high up in Otiss neck that requires surgery. Meanwhile, Bailey, a 10-year-old cocker spaniel, has quite a lot of pain in one of his hind limbs, but his owner wants to avoid surgery, and Noel needs to perform specialist imaging before he can offer any solutions

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sarah and Jonathan met at junior school as eight-year-olds and were best friends for years until they eventually got together. Now theyre in Southmead expecting their second baby, but the mother-to-be is getting increasingly anxious and the memory of her difficult first labour begins to induce a panic attack. Meanwhile, Vikki and Jack are having their first child and are keen for a big family after going through lonely and troubled upbringings themselves, while Naomi has to spend the night in hospital away from her partner Chris as she waits for labour to kick in

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Nicola and Tim, who are both nurses, hope their second childs birth will be less dramatic than their first, who was born after an emergency C-section. Expectant mum Laura, 29, has battled anorexia nervosa since she was a teenager and was told she would never be able to have children because of the impact of her eating disorder. However, she and partner Delroy are now looking forward to the arrival of baby number three. Tracy is days past her due date and her little one is refusing to make an appearance

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Its the biggest shift of the year on New Years Eve, and the responders deal with overzealous celebrations; a violent mental health case

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: A record heat wave has the city at boiling point, and officers respond to reports of a woman assaulted by her partner

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley helps people answer life-changing questions by examining their DNA. This time, Stacy meets 31-year-old Duri, who fears she may carry a potentially fatal genetic mutation and wants to test her DNA to see if she could suffer from the same disease as her mother. Elsewhere, a woman who was adopted when she was just six months old wants to use DNA technology to finally uncover information about her ancestry

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina finds herself on the horns of a dilemma - Patsy is presenting the fashion event of the year at the Royal Albert Hall, but Saffy has gone unexpectedly into labour, leaving her mother torn between love and duty

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Its Christmas Day and Richard and Adam help a family who tragically face the loss of a loved one, while Dan and Becky are called out to a baby with a worryingly high temperature

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Boxing Day arrives and paramedics Deena Evans and Mike Hipgrave race to 71-year-old Frank, who has severe chest pains and has had difficulty breathing after going shopping

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Loz and Dave are called to a hotel where a young man has been struck down with abdominal pain, while Stu and Rob treat a man with breathing difficulties who has a detachable ear

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Its New Years Eve, one of the busiest days for the West Midlands crews. Gaz and Liam help a man whose celebrations were cut short when he was hit in the head by a firework

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: As the New Year starts Simon and Fiona are called to a pregnant woman who is bleeding, while Joe and Hannah race to a young woman who has been self-harming

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Spaniel Scrumpy is suffering from lameness and Noel discovers he has a collapsed disc and severe elbow arthritis. He already has a chequered medical history totalling six previous operations to his elbows, hip and knee. Meanwhile, there is an emergency admission when a 15-month-old dachshund arrives with a mystery brain condition, and Noel and his neurology colleagues have their work cut out to identify the cause. When his condition rapidly deteriorates overnight, suddenly the life of this much-loved young dog hangs in the balance

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Four-year-old pug and beagle cross Barney is brought into Fitzpatrick Referrals after being hit by a bus. The dog has lost 40 per cent of the bone in the damaged leg, so Noel creates an innovative two-tier treatment, involving an external ankle frame for support. Sisters Rosemary and Diane bring in their five-year-old basset hound Albert when they find he is suddenly unable to move his back legs, and 10-month-old Labrador cross Gylly receives treatment for lameness and an unusual bone deformity

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets a litter of puppies known as the Potato Pups, who were found abandoned in a crisp box, and helps the staff fight to keep them alive

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Ann and Steve are called to help a woman and it becomes clear shes having a heart attack and needs surgery. Stuart and Craig treat a woman who may be having an allergic reaction

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Sam and Joel help a man who has just found out hes been exposed to HIV, while Nic and Carla visit a lady who has a painful infected foot following surgery

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Three-year-old Isaac needs an operation on his tongue, a woman has her toes straightened and part of a toe amputated, and a man has biopsies taken from his prostate

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Nigel has keyhole surgery to repair his hernia - but things go wrong when hes back on the ward. Carol has a pin removed from her ankle, which was previously fractured

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Its all hands on deck as Southmead Hospitals maternity ward reaches maximum capacity, and the midwives are concerned that the unit may have to close. Among the new arrivals are Mormon couple Jennie and Jon, who are expecting their third child, and nervous first-time parents Eve and Andy, who experienced difficulties during their two previous pregnancies

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives of Liverpool Womens Hospital invite viewers into the delivery suites one last time, introducing 27-year-old Gina and her partner James. The pair met at university, while Gina was on an exchange programme from Shanghai, and made their long-distance relationship work by chatting through cuddly toys via the internet. However, they must now demonstrate their maturity and become parents. Meanwhile, self-confessed baby machine Margy arrives expecting her fifth child, and childhood sweethearts Craig and Sarah, who faced parenthood at an early age, look forward to taking their next baby back to their own home rather than to their parents

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Forty-six-year-old Mel only found out as a teenager that she was conceived using a sperm donor. Now she wants to see if she can find her biological fathers identity by decoding her DNA, and discovers far more than she ever expected. Fi always knew she was adopted, but what she didnt know until later in life was that her father murdered her birth mother. Fi wants to know if it possible to inherit a murder gene. Presented by Stacey Dooley

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: A new boyfriend boasting a selection of lost Beatles recordings makes Eddie think shes hit the big time, but her plans to marry him and invite an elite group of producers to hear the tapes are dashed in spectacular fashion. Elton John and Robert Lindsay guest star

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Suffolk on the last leg of his 1930s Bradshaws inspired tour of East Anglia, visiting the racecourse at Newmarket and the Roman Catholic shrine at Walsingham

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Crewe, a town steeped in railway history, to investigate the making of cinema classic The Night Mail during the 1930s. He then heads to Chester to discover the interwar origins of Britains most popular zoo, then goes across the border to the Welsh village of Gresford, scene of one of Britains worst mining disasters

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos 1930s Bradshaws-inspired railway tour continues in north Wales. In Colwyn Bay, Michael hears how an army of civil servants from the Ministries of Food and Agriculture in London invaded the quiet seaside town, before visiting an amusement park in the holiday resort of Rhyl. Crossing the Menai Strait by the Britannia Bridge, Michael arrives on Anglesey and the elegant seat of the Marquesses of the island

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his 1936 Bradshaws-inspired railway tour of north Wales. He begins in the coastal city of Bangor, where he hears how, when war broke out in September 1939, 2,000 children from the cities of northern England were evacuated by train to north Wales. Heading inland alongside the River Conwy, Michael reaches Tal y Cafn, before investigating the worst dam disaster in Welsh history in Dolgarrog. Finally in Betws y Coed, he attempts to climb one of Snowdonias lesser peaks

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The great pick-off continues as Mike and Danielle continue their team effort to take on Frank and Robbie for ultimate picking bragging rights

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A century-old Italian grocery store-turned-time capsule features an early 20th-century delivery truck and a secret crypt that is calling Mikes name

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The Pickers set out on a presidential trail as Mike and Danielle head for Pennsylvania while Frank and Robbie are on a whistle-stop tour of North Dakota

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien head to Northamptonshire in search of more upcycling prospects. Simon finds some night vision goggles and an antique snooker table thats seen better days, while Henry chooses an enormous US army truck as one of his picks

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien turn an old, unloved filing cabinet into a valuable and desirable storage unit and convert a Bakelite voltmeter into a retro Bluetooth speaker

programme.title: Porridge

programme.title: Guy Martin: Proper Jobs
programme.desc: Documentary series in which Guy Martin gets stuck into doing some of the most demanding and often dangerous jobs in the UK. From working as a deckhand on a fishing trawler to taking the opportunity to work as a search and rescue dog handler in the Highlands of Scotland, the jobs that Guy undertakes require skill, physical effort and courage.

programme.title: How Britain Worked
programme.desc: Engineering enthusiast Guy Martin celebrates the workers of the Industrial Revolution by recreating some of the 19th centurys most impressive technical achievements. Along the way he focuses on the unsung heroes of the time - the men, women and children who worked 14 hours a day for little pay to create extraordinary marvels that changed the country for ever. He begins by overhauling a steam locomotive currently in use on the Severn Valley Railway, repairing its boiler, safety valves and one of its two-ton wheels. He also lays some track using the same methods as the notorious navvies - the notorious, hard-living labourers who put together Britains entire railway infrastructure by hand

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.desc: Up for auction this week is a 1980 Ford Escort, a hand-built 1946 Bedford 12 electric car, and a beautiful, red 1957 Austin Healey.

Later, at Fowey, the former politician rediscovers a lost literary figure known as Q, who immortalised the town in his novels

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses fly with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the worlds mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the worlds largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: On the fourth leg of his journey through the continent, Simon travels through three of the worlds most extreme environments as he takes in the salt flats of Bolivia, Brazils Pantanal wetland region and Paraguays Chaco Forest. In Bolivia, he meets a family making a living carving salt from the vast white expanse of the Uyuni flats, while in Brazil he has a close encounter with South Americas apex predator, the jaguar. In Paraguay, Simon visits a Mennonites school, where traditionally clothed children are drilled in Bible texts and there are no smartphones to be seen
